Elliotte Harold wrote:

> Any ideas?

Yes, but not the kind of idea you wanted. Maybe you already know this, 
but I'll share it anyway, in case it helps. I strongly recommend your 
students start with at least a small amount of already test-driven code. 
Especially in shorter formats (1/2 day or less), starting with a blank 
slate tends to be onerous.

That said, I like the "checkbook" suggestion. Another possibility is a 
personal organizer/scheduler, because it requires a little bit of 
business-type behavior (dealing with conflicting/overlapping 
appointments -- should we allow them or not?), is familiar and even a 
little behavior can be useful.

Good luck.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
